page.title: 06Bishop Carpenter School
page.content: Bishop Carpenter School is a small village school in {North Newington} near Banbury. It is quite a small school because it only takes {98 children}. The school is on School Lane and has a sloping field at the side. The school was built in {1853} out of local stone. The farthest distance a pupil has to come to the school is 6 miles. The school field is not a proper public field but it is used as one. The school was named after {Bishop Carpenter} who was the Bishop of Oxford. He is still alive at the grand age of 90. The most common villages that the children come from are Broughton, North Newington and Shutford. The school has 3 classes, 3 full time teachers and 2 part time teachers. The children have to wear a uniform. Jody Lucas
